snippet: The offices of the attorney general and the comptroller received draft copies of the confidential settlement of sexual misconduct allegations against Assemblyman Vito J. Lopez, but did not intervene.
abstract: Offices of New York State Atty Gen Eric Schneiderman and Comptroller Thomas DiNapoli downplay their roles in confidential settlement of sexual misconduct against Assemblyman Vito J Lopez; offices were told of $135,000 payoff but did not intervene; good-government groups are calling for an examination of how the two offices handled the matter.

byline.original: By DANNY HAKIM and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM

lead_paragraph: The offices of the attorney general and the comptroller received draft copies of the confidential settlement of sexual misconduct allegations against Assemblyman Vito J. Lopez, but did not intervene.

headline.seo: Offices of Eric T. Schneiderman and Thomas P. DiNapoli Play Down Roles in Settlement
headline.main: Attorney General and Comptroller Play Down Their Roles in Settlement
headline.print_headline: Attorney General and Comptroller Play Down Their Roles in Settlement
